stories.title: The Lost Sheep
stories.setting: Various locations including dark caves, deep valleys, and behind a big rock
plot: The Shepherd counts his sheep but realizes one is missing.
He decides to leave the ninety-nine to find the lost sheep.
The Shepherd faces warnings from a neighbor who fears he might lose all the sheep.
The Shepherd searches for the lost sheep in various places, hearing only echoes.
The lost sheep is found stuck in a prickly bush, crying out for help.
The Shepherd rescues the sheep and brings it home safely.
stories.moral: Every individual is precious, and no one should be abandoned.

stories.title: The Three Little Pigs
stories.setting: A forest with houses made of straw, sticks, and bricks
plot: The three pigs build houses out of straw, sticks, and bricks.
The wolf huffs and puffs to blow down each house, succeeding with the straw and stick houses.
The third pig builds a brick house, which withstands the wolf's huffing and puffing.
In a comical twist, the pigs use a slingshot to launch the wolf into a police car.
stories.moral: Hard work and preparation lead to success, while shortcuts can lead to failure.

stories.title: Jonah in the Fish Belly
stories.setting: A boat and the belly of a giant fish
plot: Jonah refuses to listen to God and boards a boat.
A big fish swallows Jonah whole, and he finds himself in the fish's belly.
Inside the fish, Jonah realizes his mistake and prays for forgiveness.
The fish burps, Jonah is ejected from the fish, and lands on the beach.
Jonah learns his lesson and vows to follow God's guidance.
stories.moral: Disobedience leads to consequences, but repentance and prayer can bring redemption.
